title: Master P & No Limit Take Over Hollywood With "King Of The South" Biopic Casting Call
text:
5 
Hollywood, CA – As Master P continues to put the finishing touches on the first part of his personal and No Limit biopic, The Ice Cream Man: King of the South , the Colonel of the Tank opened up a huge opportunity for aspiring Hollywood actors and actresses to star in the film. 
Yesterday (March 22) Master P and Uptown Group Pictures brought their casting tour to Hollywood’s doorstep and experienced a huge turnout from all colors, creeds, genders and ranges of talent. P exclusively tells HipHopDX that the film’s rollout will be special — not just for its true “rag to riches” story but for the legacy it will create. 
“This King of the South biopic will be like the next classic after the Tupac All Eyez on Me biopic [which releases this summer],” P tells HipHopDX. “I want all the people to get excited because it’s coming real soon.” 
The casting tour will conclude in P’s hometown New Orleans on April 4. The movie will begin filming this summer and the veteran music mogul also reveals to HipHopDX he hopes for its release to come in January on Martin Luther King Jr.’s birthday next year. 
During an April 2016 conversation with HipHopDX, Master P let the cat out the bag that Queen Latifah had been added to the film’s cast , with veteran actor Wendell Pierce following suit shortly after.
